definition: (interj.) ha!/(onom. for laughter)/(slang) to be infatuated with/to adore/abbr. for 哈士奇[ha1 shi4 qi2], husky (dog)
abbr. for 哈薩克斯坦|哈萨克斯坦[Ha1 sa4 ke4 si1 tan3], Kazakhstan/abbr. for 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Harbin
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
Harbin, subprovincial city and capital of Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1] in northeast China
Harbin, subprovincial city and capital of Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1] in northeast China
to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter
to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter

sentences.english: He beat the time of Warcraft are less and less time to Kazakhstan.
sentences.chinese: 他打魔獸的時間都少，沒有那麼多的時間哈。

sentences.english: "We were discussing the history of Volantis, " Haldon said to him.
sentences.chinese: “我們正在討論瓦蘭提斯的歷史，”哈爾頓告訴他。

sentences.english: Hargett sank the ball with his brother’s 9 iron to win the prize.
sentences.chinese: 哈蓋特用他兄弟的球杆揮杆進洞贏得了獎金。

sentences.english: From a small Spanish province called La Rioja come HUARTE wines.
sentences.chinese: 來自西班牙里奧哈地區的HUARTE葡萄酒。

sentences.english: Ha ha. I bet they play this and then announce the event is over.
sentences.chinese: 哈，我打包票他們演奏完後宣佈發佈會結束。

sentences.english: The next hip-hop dance move is to extend the right foot out.
sentences.chinese: 接下來的嘻哈舞步，是擴大了右腳。

sentences.english: And David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadarezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 他奪了哈大利謝臣僕所拿的金盾牌帶到耶路撒冷。

sentences.english: For nourishing the there are a lot of benefits.
sentences.chinese: 對滋補身體是有很大的好處的哈。

sentences.english: Soon after this conversation, Haggis and Diane Gettas got married.
sentences.chinese: 這一番談話過後不久，哈吉斯和黛安就結婚了。
哈，那可真讓我開了眼界。

sentences.english: Hart is scheduled to appear in court March 10.
sentences.chinese: 哈特將於三月10日出庭受審。

sentences.english: dry red table wine from the Rioja region of northern Spain.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙北部里奧哈地區進餐時引用的乾紅葡萄酒。

sentences.english: Next up for the Reds is the visit of Huddersfield Town to Carrington at the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 曼聯的下一場比賽是本週末主場迎戰哈斯菲爾德。

sentences.english: Aaah, Indians and Chinese fighting in cyberspace.
sentences.chinese: 哈，中國人和印度人在網上互噴。

sentences.english: Senegal says it will extradite Habre on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 塞內加爾表示將於星期一把哈佈雷引渡回乍得。

sentences.english: I do hope no members drowned in your absence.
sentences.chinese: 希望別有會員在你離崗的時候溺水哈。

definition: (final particle similar to 了[le5], indicating that sth is obvious)
Oh! (exclamation of dismay etc)/see 呦呦[you1 you1]
oh (interjection indicating that one has just learned sth)
sentence-final particle that conveys informality, warmth, friendliness or intimacy/may also indicate that one is stating a fact that the other person is not aware of
(particle) marker of surprise, sudden realization, reminder
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
modal particle indicating that sth is obvious/particle indicating a pause for emphasis
(onom.) sound of singing, cheering etc/(phonetic)/(dialect) to chat
sentence-final particle, contraction of 了啊, indicating exclamation/particle placed after each item in a list of examples
(final particle equivalent to 了[le5])/(particle calling attention to, or mildly warning of, a situation)
interjection indicating approval, appreciation or agreement
(sentence-final particle expressing exhortation)/(syllable filler in a song)
